item.title: Confusion, Anger, Relief: Korean Engineer Tells of Week in U.S. ICE Detention
item.description: More than 300 employees at Hyundai battery plant returned home after being detained in a Georgia immigration raid.
item.dc:creator: Dasl Yoon

item.title: Military Drones Could Be Defense Industry’s Big Bubble, Rheinmetall’s CEO Says
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Military drones are a crucial part of war in Ukraine and are rapidly expanding, but Armin Papperger is not convinced by their market foundations.
item.dc:creator: Alistair MacDonald

item.title: Netanyahu Doubles Down on Elusive Goal: Conquering Hamas’s ‘Last Stronghold’
item.description: Israel took its war with Hamas to Qatar and is pushing ahead with a takeover of Gaza City, but a total defeat of the militant group remains elusive.
item.dc:creator: Summer Said

item.title: Russian Drone Incursion in Poland Tests NATO Defenses, Cohesion
item.description: Allies are pledging to divert resources to the bloc’s eastern flank to shore up its air defenses.
item.dc:creator: Max Colchester

item.title: Brazil’s Bolsonaro Sentenced to 27 Years in Prison
item.description: The Supreme Court found the former president guilty of plotting to overturn the 2022 election.
item.dc:creator: Samantha Pearson

item.title: Canada to Champion Mining, Energy and Port Projects in Economic Revamp
item.description: The five selected projects, which stand to help the country reduce reliance on the U.S., are expected to generate an economic boost of $43.39 billion, said Prime Minister Mark Carney.
item.dc:creator: Paul Vieira

item.title: Opinion | Wasn’t Hell Supposed to Break Loose if the U.S. Struck Iran?
item.description: ‘We can’t do this,’ Obama’s deputy national security adviser Ben Rhodes said. Years later, Trump did it.
item.dc:creator: Ray Takeyh

item.title: Opinion | Europe Has Been Going Cold on Net Zero
item.description: The most preposterous policy idea in history is running out of steam as voters feel the costs.
item.dc:creator: Joseph C. Sternberg

item.title: Opinion | The Art of Duplicity in Doha
item.description: Calling one side of the conflict an enemy while posing as a reliable intermediary should inform any sensible person why the Gaza war persists.

item.title: It’s E-Bike Mayhem in London as Strike Shuts Down Tube
item.description: Many Londoners are comparing their new commute to the Tour de France—if the cyclists wore heels, suits and could barely ride a bike.
item.dc:creator: Natasha Dangoor

item.title: South Koreans Fly Home After Hyundai Raid, Without Being Handcuffed
item.description: Workers at the EV battery plant under construction had been detained for nearly a week at Georgia detention center.
item.dc:creator: Dasl Yoon

item.title: British Ambassador to Washington Removed Over Epstein Emails
item.description: Peter Mandelson was asked to step down after new evidence of his relationship with the disgraced financier emerged.
item.dc:creator: Max Colchester

item.title: Denials and Defiance Shape Venezuela’s Response to U.S. Threats on Drugs
item.description: With U.S. warships in the Caribbean to stop Venezuelan cocaine shipments, the regime in Caracas claims it knows nothing about the trafficking of drugs.
item.dc:creator: Kejal Vyas

item.title: The American Farmers China Is Using as a Trade-War Bargaining Chip
item.description: Weeks before the harvest, China has ordered no soybeans from the U.S.—as Beijing snubs products to gain an edge.
item.dc:creator: Patrick Thomas

item.title: Israel Is Straining Its Hard-Won Ties in the Gulf
item.description: This week’s strike in Qatar cemented Arab concerns about Israel’s appetite for using its powerful military, and raised questions about whether the U.S. can be counted on to impose restraint.
item.dc:creator: Benoit Faucon

item.title: South Korean Detainees, After Delay, Set to Return Home Thursday
item.description: South Korean officials had targeted a Wednesday departure, but said a delay had occurred due to unspecified circumstances on the U.S. side.
item.dc:creator: Jiyoung Sohn

item.title: Opinion | Putin Taunts Trump and NATO
item.description: The Russian seems to think he can do what he wants without fear of U.S. sanction.
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

item.title: Trump Has Heated Call With Netanyahu Over Israeli Strike on Qatar
item.description: President Trump told the Israeli prime minister that targeting Hamas leaders in Doha wasn’t wise, and was angry to learn about the attack from the U.S. military as it occurred, senior U.S. administration officials said.
item.dc:creator: Josh Dawsey

item.title: Opinion | The Lies About Israel Are More Than ‘Foolish’
item.description: We are in the presence of an intellectual and moral collapse without a name.

item.title: After 18 Months, Prince Harry and King Charles Meet in Person
item.description: Royal father and son meet in London amid hopes of a detente in royal relations.
item.dc:creator: Max Colchester

item.title: Opinion | Qatar and the U.S. Have a Secret Deal
item.description: What are its terms and why is Congress so incurious?
item.dc:creator: Ira Stoll

item.title: Trump Weighs In on Russian Drone NATO Incursion, but Doesn’t Condemn It
item.description: European leaders swiftly and universally criticized incursion by Moscow as a dangerous escalation.
item.dc:creator: Robbie Gramer

item.title: Inside NATO’s Scramble to Shoot Down Russia’s All-Night Drone Raid Over Poland
item.description: Allies acted in concert to engage Russian drones over alliance territory for the first time.
item.dc:creator: Thomas Grove

item.title: Canada to Unveil Initial List of Priority Infrastructure, Trade Projects
item.description: Prime Minister Mark Carney said the government will identify Thursday an initial list of major infrastructure projects that it wants to pursue as part of a revamp of an economy struggling under U.S. President Trump’s tariffs.
item.dc:creator: Paul Vieira

item.title: U.K. Ambassador to U.S. Facing Calls to Quit After Epstein Disclosures
item.description: Peter Mandelson, one of the U.K’s highest-profile Trump whisperers, is under pressure over his past friendship with Jeffrey Epstein and his appearance in a book to celebrate the disgraced financier’s 50th birthday.
item.dc:creator: Max Colchester

item.title: NATO Planes Shoot Down Russian Drones Deep Inside Poland
item.description: The incident was the first time the alliance has engaged Russian drones on a member’s territory, with officials saying it was a test of its defenses.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Michaels

item.title: Trump Presses EU for Tariffs on China, India in Russia Sanctions Talks
item.description: The bloc is expected to target some foreign firms that are helping Russia, possibly including some Chinese companies, according to diplomats.
item.dc:creator: Kim Mackrael

item.title: ‘Block Everything’ Protest Rocks France: What to Know
item.description: Thousands of people have taken to the streets in response to proposed budget cuts, raising fears that Wednesday could mark the start of a new period of social unrest in France.
item.dc:creator: Noemie Bisserbe

item.title: Nepali Army Deploys to Restore Order After Violent Protests
item.description: The military says it was forced to step in to stop violence from spiraling after demonstrations led the prime minister to resign.
item.dc:creator: Krishna Pokharel

item.title: Israel’s Strike on Hamas in Qatar Shows Netanyahu Is Done Talking
item.description: The Israeli prime minister is demanding that Hamas surrender and free all the hostages, terms the U.S.-designated terror group has so far rejected.
item.dc:creator: Shayndi Raice

item.title: EU Proposes Suspending Trade Agreement With Israel
item.description: Ursula von der Leyen said events in Gaza had ‘shaken the conscience of the world’ as pressure piles on the EU to take a harder line.
item.dc:creator: Edith Hancock

item.title: Iran Agrees to Give U.N. Atomic Agency Access to Its Nuclear Sites
item.description: The agreement lacks a timeline for inspections or deadlines for Iran, but it could give a first look at the damage from this summer’s war.
item.dc:creator: Laurence Norman

item.title: Princeton Doctoral Student Freed After Being Kidnapped in Iraq
item.description: Elizabeth Tsurkov was held by an Iran-backed militia and spent 903 days in captivity.
item.dc:creator: Brett Forrest

item.title: Two Presidents, One Assassination Plot: Brazil’s Trial of the Century
item.description: Brazil’s Supreme Court will decide if former President Jair Bolsonaro tried to stage a coup after the last election, and allegedly plotted to kill his opponents.
item.dc:creator: Samantha Pearson

item.title: A Ukrainian Farmer Fought Back Against the Russians. He Paid With His Life.
item.description: Farming in Ukraine’s southern Kherson region has become a deadly profession as Russian drone pilots target civilians.

item.title: Inside Israel’s Audacious Airstrike on Hamas Leaders in Qatar, a U.S. Ally
item.description: The U.S.-designated terrorist group gathered at its Doha headquarters, giving Israel a shot at killing several political leaders.
item.dc:creator: Lara Seligman

item.title: Israel Attacks Hamas Senior Leadership in Doha, Qatar
item.description: The strike represents a sharp escalation of tactics against the group and a potentially risky operation on the soil of a key U.S. partner in the region.
item.dc:creator: Summer Said

item.title: Macron’s Reward for Cutting French Taxes: Sluggish Growth and a Political Crisis
item.description: The president wanted to transform the economy, but he is now trying to chart a path forward with a growing deficit and gridlock in parliament.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Dalton

item.title: Fueled by Anger Over Corruption, Nepal Protesters Topple Prime Minister
item.description: Demonstrators in Kathmandu defied curfews to attack properties of political leaders they held responsible for the deaths of at least 19 protesters.
item.dc:creator: Tripti Lahiri

item.title: Hyundai Raid Exposes Shortage of Visas for Asian Companies Trying to Move Staff
item.description: Asian companies are having trouble getting enough work visas for personnel needed to get U.S. factories running, immigration specialists say.
item.dc:creator: Yang Jie

item.title: U.S.-China Rivalry Sparks a Submarine Arms Race
item.description: Beijing’s fleet is getting quieter and more lethal, while Washington leads in tech but lags in production.

item.title: Kenya Uses U.S.-Funded Antiterrorism Courts for Political Crackdown
item.description: Young people who took to the streets to protest corruption and poor job prospects could face decades in maximum-security prison under a set of laws set up to combat al Qaeda.
item.dc:creator: Caroline Kimeu

item.title: Milei’s Election Setback Rattles Markets in Argentina
item.description: The underperformance of President Javier Milei’s party in a provincial election raises questions about support for his pro-market overhauls.
item.dc:creator: Kejal Vyas

item.title: Is the U.K. a Canary in the Coal Mine for a Heavily Indebted World?
item.description: Borrowing costs are surging for many industrialized countries, causing talk of a possible crisis.
item.dc:creator: Ed Ballard

item.title: This Is the World’s Biggest Animal Migration—and Few Outsiders Have Seen It
item.description: Six million antelope storm through a pocket of Africa that’s nearly impossible to get to, but the Journal caught them on camera. “The entire planet should be amazed that this exists.”
item.dc:creator: Annie Ng

item.title: U.N. Accuses Rwanda-Backed Rebels of Slaughtering Children, Other Civilians in Congo
item.description: M23 rebels in the Democratic Republic of Congo committed what might have been war crimes and crimes against humanity, raping women and executing children and other civilians, the United Nations said.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Bariyo

item.title: Beijing’s New Playbook for Trade Talks: Keep Talking but Give No Ground
item.description: China sent a trade envoy to Washington with a clear message: We’re willing to talk, but we’re not ready to make a deal.

item.title: Putin Says Russia Will Strike Any Western Troops in Ukraine
item.description: The Russian leader’s comments came a day after European and U.S. officials met in Paris to discuss security guarantees for Kyiv.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Luxmoore

item.title: How China’s New Naval and Air Sites Would Aid an Attack on Taiwan
item.description: A large-scale build-out of infrastructure along China’s eastern coast shows a growing readiness for a potential conflict.

item.title: Mexico’s Cartels Are Exporting Their Bloody Rivalry to Ecuador and Beyond
item.description: The two most powerful drug rings are locked in a turf war over control of a key South American smuggling route. The bodies are piling up.

item.title: He Jokes About Trump and Invading Kenya—and May Be Uganda’s Next President
item.description: Muhoozi Kainerugaba, son of the longtime ruler, oversees a key U.S. military partner while boasting about torture and threatening to arrest members of parliament.

item.title: China Flaunts Military Might With Lavish Parade—and Sends Warning to Washington
item.description: Xi Jinping rolls out his latest weapons and a red carpet for Russia’s Vladimir Putin and North Korea’s Kim Jong Un.

item.title: Russia, China Close In on Pipeline Deal, Leaving Beijing With the Upper Hand
item.description: The two countries advanced plans for the long-delayed pipeline to funnel Russian fuel to China but left core terms unresolved, a sign of Beijing’s growing leverage.
item.dc:creator: Georgi Kantchev

item.title: The Black Market for Oil Blunts Trump’s India Tariffs
item.description: The extra levy meant to punish New Delhi for buying cheap Russian crude isn’t going as expected.
item.dc:creator: Carol Ryan

item.title: U.S. Tariffs on India Skirt Its Biggest Buyer of Russian Oil
item.description: Reliance Industries accounts for about a third of the Russian oil India imports.
item.dc:creator: Tripti Lahiri

item.title: India Braces for the Pain of Trump’s Stiff Tariffs
item.description: Duties that just took effect will hit billions of dollars of trade and hurt Indian sectors ranging from textiles to farming.
item.dc:creator: Tripti Lahiri

item.title: The Ukrainian Attacks That Are Forcing Russia to Ration Its Fuel
item.description: The late Sen. John McCain once called Russia “a gas station with nukes.” Now, because of Ukrainian attacks, it must ration fuel.
item.dc:creator: Georgi Kantchev

item.title: Russia Covets This Ukraine Province Above All. These Maps and Charts Show Why.
item.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin thinks he can make a hugely significant strategic gain at the negotiating table rather than on the battlefield.

item.title: Decades After Genocide, Rwanda Emerges as Aggressive Regional Power
item.description: The tiny country has evolved from an object of sympathy into a controversial and feared powerhouse.

item.title: Trump Gives Familiar Two-Week Deadline for Next Steps to End War in Ukraine
item.description: President Trump offered a new—and familiar—deadline for the leaders of Russia and Ukraine to move forward with a peace process or else face possible U.S. retaliation, saying he’d make a determination within “two weeks.”
item.dc:creator: Alexander Ward

item.title: Why India Can’t Afford to Jettison Its Relationship With Russia
item.description: Despite the threat of U.S. tariffs, New Delhi is resisting pressure to cut longtime ties with Moscow that have brought economic and geopolitical benefits.

item.title: India Defies Trump on Russian Oil Despite Tariff Threats
item.description: Indian experts believe the U.S. president is trying to gain short-term leverage in trade negotiations with New Delhi.

item.title: The Best Travel Shoes to Make Every Trip Lighter and Easier
item.description: No matter the destination, these shoes will get you there.

item.description: From commuting to long-haul flights, these are the bags avid travelers rely on for their trips.

item.title: Best of Buy Side Awards 2025: Travel
item.description: Tried and tested by our expert travel writers and editors, these Buy Side best product award-winning luggage picks will ensure your trip gets off to a great start.
item.dc:creator: Nick Guy

item.title: Families Battle Tech Giants as Australia Pushes for an Under-16 Social-Media Ban
item.description: The proposal marks the latest effort by political leaders worldwide to regulate children’s use of platforms, amid concerns that it is harming their mental health.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney

item.title: ‘We’ve Got to Kill’: Inside New Zealand’s Mission to Wipe Out Predators
item.description: Scientists debate whether a multibillion-dollar plan to eliminate invasive animals by 2050 is feasible.

item.title: France’s Macron Tries to Quell New Caledonia Riots With Globe-Crossing Trip
item.description: The French leader said he is open to suspending a voting-rights bill that sparked the riots once order is restored on the archipelago and talks resume between rival factions.

item.title: France Rushes Reinforcements to Riot-Stricken New Caledonia
item.description: Unrest in the overseas territory could derail President Emmanuel Macron’s efforts to restore French influence in the Indo-Pacific region.

item.title: Australia to Boost Defense Spending Amid U.S.-China Tensions
item.description: Australia is boosting its defense budget and rethinking its defense plans as strategic competition between the U.S. and China heats up in the Indo-Pacific region.
